moves.1. e3 e5 2. Nc3: My standard opening working only for the black,so I send out my knight, partly because I don't know what to do, and partly because to stop the procession of the king-side pawn.
moves.2... Nc6 3. Nf3: I send out my knight for the castle I intend to do as fast as I can, and also because I might get a chance of getting that pawn after all.
moves.3... d6: Ruined my hope for the pawn
moves.4. Bb5 Bd7 5. h3 a6 6. Be2: Usually, I would have taken the knight for the e5 pawn, but seeing that it wasn't going to happen, I retreated to e2. This move locked me in for a short period of time.
moves.6... Bf5: Just to mention, I am not bright at what enemy would do in long term. I just make it up as I go.( quite well, actually)
moves.7. O-O e4 8. Nd4 Nxd4 9. exd4 d5 10. Bg4: Thinking that there wasn't going to be another chance, I took the bishop. Now I also see that move freed my queen.
I don't know why he made that move. please comment
moves.16. Re1+ Be7 17. Qd4: I thought this was a good move, but now I see that I could have forced his queen with Bg5
moves.17... Kd7 18. Qe5 Re8 19. Qf4 Bd6: I thought this was my chance, well, i just didn't see what was going to happen.
moves.20. Qxf7+ Qe7 21. Rxe7+ Rxe7: Here, I got my answer for why he pushed queen, not the rook. If I don't take the rook e5, He would checkmate me.
moves.22. Qxe7+ Kxe7: I believe it would have been better to take with a bishop, for then I couldn't have gotten the extra turn by checking him.
moves.23. Bg5+ Kd7 24. c4 Re8: He couldn't have been dumb enough to go for a checkmate, but I still decided by moving Bishop to e3, I would be able to push the pawn to c5.
moves.25. Be3 h5: Thank god for his sense of wasting turns.
moves.27. Rd1 h4 28. a4 a5 29. Kf1: A move that came in handy after a while.
moves.30. c3: I forgot that I could push the pawn two places( how dumb!)
moves.30... g5 31. d6 cxd6: He was dumb enough to take it, which led to his doom.
moves.32. cxd6 Bf4 33. Bxf4: Did I mention that I love exchanges?
moves.33... gxf4 34. Rd4 Rf8 35. Ke2: Thanks to previous move, I was able to move here.
moves.35... Rf6 36. c4 Rxd6 37. Rxf4 Kc6 38. R: An exchange that was costly for black.
moves.41. Kf3 Kxc4: He chose to take the pawn for a chance of queen.
moves.42. h4 b5 43. axb5: He probably didn't expect the fact that he had to take that pawn.
moves.43... Kxb5 44. h5 a4 45. h6 a3 46. h7 Kb: realizing pawn push will bring his doom, he moves his king.
moves.47. h8=Q Kb3 48. g4 a2 49. g5 Kc2 50. g6: He wanted me to push the pawn, which would have earned him a queen, but realizing that I would willingly take that pawn after his only possible move, pawn to a1, he resigned.
